title: CVE-2024-3094-detector
description: Checks if the local machine is vulnerable to CVE-2024-3094 and currently affected by CVE-2024-3094

title: env_verify
description: Verifies whether the Java environment and command line options of your log4j-enabled Java application, allow for the exploitation of CVE-2021-44228

title: log4shell_xray_wrapper
description: Searches for local Maven and Gradle projects and scans them using Xray, with the results filtered to show only the Log4Shell vulnerabilities

title: patch_rt_container_registry_repos
description: Mitigates Log4Shell in container images managed by Artifactory

title: scan-cve-2021-45046-config
description: Scans a root folder and all archive files in it, looking for probable log4j configuration files (xml , yml , properties , json), in each looking for configuration options which may enable an attacker to exploit CVE-2021-45046

title: scan-log4j-calls-jar
description: Recursively scans all .jar files in a root folder, for each printing out locations (class name and method name) of calls to info/warn/error/log/debug/trace/fatal methods of log4j2.Logger.

title: scan-log4j-calls-src
description: Recursively scans all .java files in a root folder, for each printing out locations (file name and corresponding code lines) of calls to log4j2 logging methods.

title: scan-log4j-versions
description: Recursively scans a root folder for .jar and .war files; For every file that is detected, the plugin looks for the vulnerable Log4Shell classes and reports whether the binary is vulnerable.

title: scan_spring
description: Scans a root folder recursively for .jar and .war files which contain web endpoints that may be vulnerable to CVE-2022-22965

title: nimbuspwn-detector
description: Checks if the current system is vulnerable to Nimbuspwn

title: CVE-2018-25032-detector
description: Scans a path recursively and prints binaries that use deflateInit2() - which makes them potentially susceptible to CVE-2018-25032

title: pwnkit-detector
description: Checks if the current system is vulnerable to PwnKit

title: npm-secure-install
description: Validates dependencies are locked down to the exact versions before installation of global tools

title: package-checker
description: Checks a dependency string for what will actually be installed and whether it is suspicious

title: npm-issues-statistics
description: Analyzes GitHub comments to find unusual activity that might correlate to compromised dependency

title: npm-domain-check
description: Checks if a specific npm package may be susceptible to domain hijacking(directly or via dependencies)

title: scan_commons_text_versions
description: Recursively searches for the class code of StringLookupFactory (regardless of containing .jar file names and content of pom.xml files), and attempts to fingerprint the versions of the objects to report whether the included version of commons-text is vulnerable.

title: scan_commons_text_calls_jar
description: Locates the calls to the vulnerable TextShell functions in compiled .jar files, and reports the findings as class name and method names in which each call appears.

title: text_4_shell_patch
description:
Looks for the vulnerable ScriptStringLookup class in the commons-text jar given and disables the lookup() function, effectively patching the vulnerability
The tool can also patch (disable) the vulnerable DnsStringLookup and URLStringLookup funtionalities

title: openssl_req_client_cert
description: Determines whether client authentication is required by the SSL server, in which case servers based on OpenSSL 3.0.0..3.0.6 will be vulnerable to CVE-2022-3602 & CVE-2022-3786

title: scan_vulnerable_openssl_code
description: Finds binaries with a statically-linked version of OpenSSL. Specifically the tool diferentiates between OpenSSL 3.0.0-3.0.6 (vulnerable versions) and 3.0.7 (fixed version).
